docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Welcome

Documentation about how to run HCL Domino on the various Linux distributions. This page is community supported and welcomes contributions.

Table of contents {: .text-delta } 1. TOC {:toc}

docs.title: Background
docs.text: The system requirements for HCL Domino include RHEL/CentOS and SUSE because those are the releases that HCL has tested (aka "certified") to run on. However, HCL Domino will run on other distributions if a certain minimum criteria is met. This repository is documenting which flavours of Linux customers have reported to be running HCL Domino on and what to be aware of.

docs.title: HCL Domino Compatibility
docs.text:
This table provides the collective knowledge of which distribution are known to be working with a Domino version. Please note, only distributions declared as "Certified" are tested by HCL.

HCL Domino on Linux Compatibility Matrix Linux Distribution Domino 14.5 Domino 14 Domino 12 Domino 11 Redhat Enterprise Linux Certified Certified Certified Certified SUSE Linux (SLES) Certified Certified Certified Certified Amazon Linux Yes Yes Yes Yes Alma Linux Yes Yes Yes Yes Astra Linux Unknown Unknown Yes Yes CentOS Stream Yes Yes Yes Yes Debian Yes Yes Yes Yes OpenSUSE Yes Yes Yes Yes Oracle Linux Yes Yes Yes Yes Rocky Linux Yes Yes Yes Yes Ubuntu Yes Yes Yes Yes VMware Photon OS 5.0 Yes Yes Yes Yes

docs.title: Experimental
docs.text:
Linux distributions in this chapter are rolling releases, so any compatibility statement can be obsolete by the time you are reading this document. Be careful, use at your own risk!

HCL Domino on Linux Compatibility Matrix Linux Distribution Domino 14.5 Domino 14 Domino 12 Domino 11 Arch Linux No No No No Fedora Unknown Unknown Unknown Unknown Kali Linux Experimental Experimental Experimental Experimental OpenSUSE Tumbleweed Unknown Unknown Unknown Unknown Wolfi OS No No No No

docs.title: Definition
docs.text: Compatibility Definition Color Explanation Certified HCL has tested and supports this platform Yes Although not tested by HCL, seems to work just fine Limited May work with some some limitations. Use at your own risk No Has been tested and will not work Unknown Requires testing and may not be fully usuable

docs.title: Will not work

What will not work

Lessons learned on what will NOT work.

Table of contents {: .text-delta } 1. TOC {:toc}

docs.title: ARM CPU
docs.text:
HCL Domino is not compiled for ARM CPU's and will not work on the following hardware * Raspberry Pi * Intel Atom CPU's * Amazon EC2 Graviton * Apple Silicon (M1/M2/M3/M4 CPU's)

There are several AHA ideas out there - please vote for them if you want HCL Domino to be supporting ARM CPU's * ARM version of Domino Server on Linux * Domino on Docker in the ARM based Apple Silicon M1/M2/M3/M4 * Domino Designer for ARM

docs.title: How about Emulators?
docs.text: We have tested running the x86 version of Domino on ARM CPU's in compatibility mode. While it is somewhat possible, e.g. in a docker container, it is not fun to work with as performance is 10x slower.

docs.title: Mainframe / zLinux / zOS
docs.text:
HCL Domino is not compiled for Mainframe CPUs and will NOT work on the following * OS/390 - although older versions of Domino used to support z/OS, see this IBM Redbook * IBM zLinux * IBM LinuxOne * IBM Telum

Please vote this idea if you want HCL Domino to be supporting Mainframes * Support for Domino on z/OS / zLinux

docs.title: Special Linux distributions
docs.text:
The following Linux distributions have been tested but will NOT work with Domino.

  • Wolfi OS

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Installation Methods

Installing HCL Domino on Linux can be done in different ways

Table of contents {: .text-delta } 1. TOC {:toc}

docs.title: Before you start
docs.text:
1. Check the system requirements for HCL Domino
  2. Update Linux
  3. Get the HCL Domino installer for Linux from HCL's SW Download Portal
  4. The following will be used: 
    User : notes
Group: notes
Binary Directory: /opt/hcl/domino
Data Directory  : /local/notesdata

docs.title: Manual installation
docs.text:
• To start the Domino installer, you must be root
sudo su
./install

{% include yewtube.html id="fW1iPlcoDSo" %}

  • Install Domino Server on Linux Environment
  • For more information, see online help

docs.title: Scripted Installation
docs.text:
Probably the easiest and fastest way to install a HCL Domino server is to use an installation script, e.g. the one provided by Daniel in the Domino-StartScript repository

curl -sL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nashcom/domino-startscript/main/install_domino.sh | bash -

docs.title: Silent Installation
docs.text:
For a silent installation, a response file containing the installation options is envoked when running the installer

sudo ./install -r ./responseFile/installer.properties

For more information see online help

docs.title: GUI Installation
docs.text: tbd

docs.title: Container / Docker / Kubernetes
docs.text: Installing Domino in a container environment is not covered in this repository. For more information see this

docs.text: The de-facto standard for anyone running HCL Domino on Linux. Fore more information see this

docs.title: ArchLinux
docs.text:
This Linux distribution is a rolling release which updates dependencies at any time. So even if HCL Domino would be running today, a small update of the OS can break it at any time.

We are not recommending to use ArchLinux for HCL Domino.

docs.title: Astra Linux Special Edition
docs.text: Commercial Linux distribution

docs.title: Astra Linux Common Edition
docs.text:
HCL Domino 12.0.x {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 11.0.1

Free Linux distribution, customers have successfully installed Domino.

docs.title: What to be aware of
docs.text:
When adding a new user with adduser the -U option to create a matching group wasn't available but generating a group before with addgroup and using that group-id when creating the user via --gid worked as expected.

  • The Domino installer will report the environment isn't supported.

  • additional packages sysstat and gdb (GNU Debugger needed by NSD) may be useful

  • NSH Start Script does not completely install automatically. The directory /etc/sysconfig is missing. Create an empty directory to fix it.

  • NSD Debugging requires ptrace, which is disabled by default.

  • Check if ptrace lock is enabled: systemctl is-enabled astra-ptrace-lock enabled
  • Disable ptrace lock: astra-ptrace-lock disable
  • Check again that it is disabled: systemctl is-enabled astra-ptrace-lock disabled

  • Reboot the server for changes to take effect.

  • Performance Tuning: add "elevator=noop" to your grub kernel boot line using the graphical grub configuration. To check the settings use

cat /sys/block/sda/queue/scheduler [noop] deadline cfq

For more details see * HCL Domino on Astralinux by Daniel Nashed

Standard installation methods apply.

Use at your own risk No Has been tested and will not work Unknown Requires testing and may not be fully usuable

docs.title: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server
docs.text:
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES)

https://www.suse.com/products/server/

Table of contents {: .text-delta } 1. TOC {:toc}

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: | --- | --- | | Certified by HCL | Yes | | License | GPL | | Package Manager | zypper | | Filesystem | brtfs, ZFS | | Based on | | | Support | | | Read more | Wikipedia: SUSE Linux | | Download | Evaluation Copy |

docs.title: Compatibility
docs.text: HCL Domino compatibility with SUSE Linux Linux Distribution Domino 14.5 Domino 14 Domino 12 Domino 11 SUSE Linux (SLES) 16 Yes Maybe Maybe Maybe SUSE Linux (SLES) 15 SP7 Yes Yes Yes Maybe SUSE Linux (SLES) 15 SP6 Certified Certified Yes Maybe SUSE Linux (SLES) 15 SP3 No No Certified Certified SUSE Linux (SLES) 12.x No No Certified Certified

docs.title: Versions
docs.text: Which versions of this Linux distribution exists in the market and what HCL Domino version they are compatible with.

docs.title: SUSE Linux Enterprise 16
docs.text:
HCL Domino 14.5 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 14.0 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 12.0.2 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 11.0.1

  • SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 16 - What's New

docs.title: SUSE Linux Enterprise 15 SP7
docs.text:
HCL Domino 14.5 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 14.0 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 12.0.2 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 11.0.1

Customers have reported Domino 14.5, 14.0 and 12.0.2 to run on SLES 15 SP7, but HCL has not certified this version yet. For Domino 11.0.1 no information exist

  • SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 15 SP7 Release Notes

docs.title: SUSE Linux Enterprise 15 SP6
docs.text:
HCL Domino 14.5 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 14.0 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 12.0.2 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 11.0.1

Domino 14.5 has been certified to run on SLES 16 SP6. Furthermore customers have reported Domino 14 + 12.0.2 to run on SLES 15 SP6, but HCL has not certified this version yet. For Domino 11.0.1 no information exist

  • SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 15 SP6 Release Notes

docs.title: SUSE Linux Enterprise 15 SP3
docs.text:
HCL Domino 14.5 {: .label .label-red } HCL Domino 14.0 {: .label .label-red } HCL Domino 12.0.2 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 11.0.1

{: .warning } HCL Domino 14 requires glibc to be provided in a specific version which SUSE Linux 15 SP3 does not provide. SLES 15sp6 provides glibc in the required version but has not been fully tested yet.

Domino 12.0.2 and 11.0.1 are certified on SLES 15 SP3 (with kernel 5.3) for details see Domino 12.0.2 System Requirements

docs.title: SUSE Linux Enterprise 12
docs.text:
HCL Domino 14.5 {: .label .label-red } HCL Domino 14.0 {: .label .label-red } HCL Domino 12.0.2 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 11.0.1

{: .warning } HCL Domino 14 requires glibc to be provided in a specific version which SUSE Linux 12 does not provide.

docs.title: References
docs.text: • OpenSUSE Leap is a distribution similar to SLES but free of charge.

docs.title: Compatibility
docs.text: HCL Domino compatibility with Ubuntu Linux Linux Distribution Domino 14.5 Domino 14 Domino 12 Domino 11 Ubuntu 25.10 (Oracular Oriole) Unknown Unknown Unknown Unknown Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (Noble Numbat) Yes Yes Yes Unknown Ubuntu 22.04 (Jammy Jellyfish) Yes Yes Yes Yes

docs.title: Versions
docs.text: Which versions of this Linux distribution exists in the market and what HCL Domino version they are compatible with.

docs.title: Ubuntu 25.10 (Oracular Oriole)
docs.text: Although customers have reported that Domino runs just fine on this release, we recommend using LTS versions of Ubuntu.

docs.title: Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (Noble Numbat)
docs.text:
HCL Domino 14.5 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 14.0 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 12.0.x {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 11.0.1

Customers have reported that Domino runs just fine.

docs.title: Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (Jammy Jellyfish)
docs.text:
HCL Domino 14.5 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 14.0 {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 12.0.x {: .label .label-green } HCL Domino 11.0.1

Customers have reported that Domino runs just fine
